project.name: Common Lisp
project.description: The Gentoo Common Lisp Project handles all Gentoo related Common Lisp implementations, applications and libraries in Portage. The project will also handle maintenance of non-Common Lisp ebuilds assigned to the Common Lisp Herd.
project.plannedproject: An overview of supported Common Lisp implementations and libraries in Portage.
Documentation on how to use the Common Lisp packages with ASDF and the Common Lisp Controller.
Documentation on the internals of the Gentoo Common Lisp supported implementations and libraries.
Answers to miscellaneous questions not covered in the Overview or User Guide.
Create and maintain an IRC channel on Freenode.net devoted to Common Lisp on Gentoo.

body.p: Common Lisp development in Gentoo takes place in the Portage Overlay.

We recognize not everyone wants to endure the Gentoo New Developer Process in order to contribute to the project. Therefore we intend to move the Common Lisp related ebuilds in CVS to the Darcs-managed, Portage Overlay Hosted at http://common-lisp.net/. This will allow users to track changes and submit improvements far more easily than through the official Gentoo Bugzilla system.

Users and Gentoo developers will be able to work together by pushing and pulling patch sets from their individual Darcs repositories. Periodically, Gentoo developers may update the official Portage CVS tree with ebuilds from the Darcs overlay.
The Portage Overlay Mailing List is for discussing the development of the Common Lisp related ports in Gentoo.
